member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Kooboo.Collections.DynamicDictionary.GetDynamicMemberNames
member.summary: Returns the enumeration of all dynamic member names.
member.returns: A sequence that contains dynamic member names.

member.name: M:Kooboo.Collections.DynamicDictionary.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as getting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty) statement, where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The result of the get operation. For example, if the method is called for a property, you can assign the property value to .
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: M:Kooboo.Collections.DynamicDictionary.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as setting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member to which the value is being assigned. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The value to set to the member. For example, for sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, the is "Test".
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)

member.summary: Scaling interpolation mode . can be HighQualityBicubic, Bilinear, etc.

member.name: P:Kooboo.Drawing.Filters.ResizeFilter.KeepAspectRatio
member.summary: Determines whether to keep the original aspect ratio false by default. Should be turned on before setting the width or height to keep the original ratio

member.name: P:Kooboo.Drawing.Filters.ResizeFilter.LockRatioByHeight
member.summary: Locks the aspect ratio while keeping the height as reference. Meaning that setting a new height will calc the width according to the original ratio

member.name: P:Kooboo.Drawing.Filters.ResizeFilter.LockRatioByWidth
member.summary: Locks the aspect ratio while keeping the width as reference. Meaning that setting a new width will calc the height according to the original ratio

member.name: M:Kooboo.Drawing.Quantizer.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.param: If true, the quantization only needs to loop through the source pixels once
member.remarks: If you construct this class with a true value for singlePass, then the code will, when quantizing your image, only call the 'QuantizeImage' function. If two passes are required, the code will call 'InitialQuantizeImage' and then 'QuantizeImage'.

member.name: M:Kooboo.Drawing.Quantizer.Quantize(System.Drawing.Image)
member.summary: Quantize an image and return the resulting output bitmap
member.returns: A quantized version of the image

member.name: M:Kooboo.Drawing.Quantizer.FirstPass(System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Execute the first pass through the pixels in the image
member.param: The width in pixels of the image
The height in pixels of the image

member.summary: Execute a second pass through the bitmap
member.param: The source bitmap, locked into memory
The width in pixels of the image
The height in pixels of the image

member.summary: Override this to process the pixel in the first pass of the algorithm
member.remarks: This function need only be overridden if your quantize algorithm needs two passes, such as an Octree quantizer.

member.summary: Override this to process the pixel in the second pass of the algorithm
member.returns: The quantized value

member.summary: Retrieve the palette for the quantized image
member.param: Any old palette, this is overrwritten
member.returns: The new color palette

member.summary: Flag used to indicate whether a single pass or two passes are needed for quantization.

member.summary: Struct that defines a 32 bpp colour

member.summary: Return the color for this Color32 object

member.name: M:Kooboo.Dynamic.DynamicDictionary.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Kooboo.Dynamic.DynamicDictionary.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Kooboo.Dynamic.DynamicDictionary.GetDynamicMemberNames
member.summary: Returns the enumeration of all dynamic member names.
member.returns: A sequence that contains dynamic member names.

member.name: M:Kooboo.Dynamic.DynamicDictionary.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as getting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty) statement, where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The result of the get operation. For example, if the method is called for a property, you can assign the property value to .
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: M:Kooboo.Dynamic.DynamicDictionary.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as setting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member to which the value is being assigned. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The value to set to the member. For example, for sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, the is "Test".
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)

member.returns: true if the specified key contains key; otherwise, false.
